content.description: A sine wave oscillating symmetrically around the x-axis (zero stress). The peak is labeled $\sigma_{max}$ and the trough is labeled $\sigma_{min}$. The mean stress $\sigma_m = 0$ is indicated by the x-axis.

A sine wave starting from zero, going to a positive peak, then back to zero. The peak is labeled $\sigma_{max}$. The minimum stress $\sigma_{min} = 0$ is indicated by the x-axis. Lines for mean stress $\sigma_m$ and stress amplitude $\sigma_a$ are also marked on the y-axis.

A sine wave oscillating between a positive peak $\sigma_{max}$ and a negative trough $\sigma_{min}$. A mean stress line $\sigma_m$ is drawn above the x-axis, and the stress amplitude $\sigma_a$ is indicated around this mean stress line.

A 2D graph with 'compression' on the y-axis and 'tensile' on the x-axis. A diagonal line starts from the origin. Regions are labeled for different stress ratios R: R > 1 (top left), R = -1 (bottom left), R = 0 (bottom right), $0 < R < 1$ (right side).

A stress vs. number of cycles (S-N) curve. Stress is on the y-axis ($\sigma$) and No. of cycles is on the x-axis. The curve shows high stress for low cycles, and then flattens out, indicating an endurance limit or endurance load. A horizontal line is labeled 'endurance load'.

content.title: Kp
content.content: It is defined as the ratio of endurance stress without stress concentration to that of endurance stress with stress concentration.
